SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Armor
Represents an abstract class for armor items in the game.
AttackBehaviour
Represents the attack behavior of an enemy in the game.
BattlePhase
The BattlePhase class represents a specific level phase in the game where the player engages in combat with enemies.
BattlePhaseFactory
The BattlePhaseFactory class is responsible for creating instances of the BattlePhase level.
Boots
Represents concrete armor component
Character
The Character class represents a generic entity in the game that can move, attack, and interact with its environment.
ChaseBehaviour
Defines the chasing behavior for an enemy in the game.
CheckpointAction
Represents an action that sets a checkpoint within a game level when a tile is interacted with.
Chestplate
Represents concrete armor component
CollectibleItem
Represents an abstract base class for all collectible items within the game.
CollisionChecker
Handles collisions between entities, tiles.
Constants
 
Constants.DIRECTION
 
Constants.EnemyConstants
 
Constants.PlayerConstants
 
DudeMonster
Represents a concrete type of enemy in the game.
Enemy
Represents a general enemy character in the game.
EnemyAnimationState
Represents the animation state for an enemy in the game.
EnemyBehaviour
 
EnemyView
The EnemyView class is responsible for rendering enemy characters during the battle phase.
FrezeBehaviour
The FrezeBehaviour represents a behavior where an enemy is frozen for a specified duration.
GameController
The GameController class serves as the main controller in the game's MVC (Model-View-Controller) architecture.
GameLoop
The GameLoop class implements the core game loop functionality.
GameModel
Represents the core game model containing all game state, configurations, and entities.
GameView
Represents the main game view rendering component of the application.
GameWindow
Represents the main window for game application.
Generated
 
Helmet
Represents concrete armor component
Inventory
Represents an inventory system The inventory includes predefined slots for specific item categories: Slot 1: Weapon Slot 2: Helmet Slot 3: Chestplate Slot 4: Leggings Slot 5: Boots Slot 6: Shield
InventorySlot<T>
 
Item
 
ItemHandler
Handles the management and interactions of items on specific level.
ItemView
The ItemView class is responsible for rendering items in the game.
KeyHandler
Handles keyboard input for the game by implementing the KeyListener interface.
Killable
 
Leggings
Represents concrete armor component
Level
 
LevelCompleteAction
Represents an action that is executed when a level completion tile is interacted with.
LoadData
The LoadData class provides utility methods and static configurations for loading game resources
Location
Represents a game location that manages various levels, tiles, and phases.
LocationConfig
Represents the configuration for a game location.
LocationView
The LocationView class is responsible for rendering current game location on the screen.
Main
 
MouseHandler
Handles mouse input for the game by implementing the MouseListener interface.
MovingBehaviour
Represents the movement behavior logic for an enemy in the game.
ObstacleAction
Represents an action that occurs when a player interacts with an obstacle tile within the game level.
ParkourPhase
Represents a ParkourPhase level in the game.
ParkourPhaseFactory
A factory class for creating instances of the ParkourPhase.
PatrolBehaviour
Represents a patrol behavior for an enemy.
PhaseFactory
 
Player
Represents a Player character in the game.
PlayerView
This class is responsible for rendering and animating the player.
Shield
Represents concrete armor component
SingleItemSlot<T>
Represents a single-slot container for items of a specific type.
Sword
Represents a Sword, a concrete type of Weapon that can be used in combat.
Tile
Represents a tile in a game map, providing collision detection, image representation, and an optional action that can be executed upon tile interaction.
TileAction
 
TileActionHandler
Handles the interaction logic for tiles within a game level.
UI
The UI class is responsible for rendering HUD for the game
Upgradable
 
Weapon
Represents a weapon that can be used by characters This class is abstract and must be extended by specific weapon types.
